Gallery &#8211; WordPress Gallery Plugin";s:4:"slug";s:15:"nextgen-gallery";s:7:"version";s:6:"2.2.10";s:6:"author";s:45:"<a href="https://www.imagely.com">Imagely</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alexrabe";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:7:"imagely";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/imagely";s:10:"photocrati";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/photocrati";}s:8:"requires";s:5:"4.0.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.0";s:6:"rating";d:76;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1129;i:4;i:157;i:3;i:65;i:2;i:54;i:1;i:436;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1841;s:15:"support_threads";i:128;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:78;s:10:"downloaded";i:18270876;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2017-06-14 10:50pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-04-23";s:8:"homepage";s:65:"https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/nextgen-gallery/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:6274:"<h4>WordPress Gallery Plugin</h4>
<p>NextGEN Gallery has been the industry&#8217;s standard <strong>WordPress gallery plugin</strong> since 2007 and continues to receive over 1.5 million new downloads per year. It&#8217;s easy for simple photo galleries, but powerful enough for the most demanding photographers, visual artists, and imaging professionals.</p>
<p>On the back end, NextGEN offers a complete WordPress gallery management system with the ability to batch upload photos, import meta data, add/delete/rearrange/sort photos, edit thumbnails, group galleries into albums, and more.</p>
<p>On the front end, the free version of NextGEN provides two main gallery display styles (slideshows and thumbnail galleries) and two album styles (compact and extended), all of which come with a wide array of options for controlling size, style, timing, transitions, controls, lightbox effects, and more.</p>
<p>Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN WordPress Gallery Plugin features.</a></p>
<p><strong>Demos</strong><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-thumbnail-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Basic Thumbnail Gallery Demo</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-slideshow-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Basic Slideshow Gallery Demo</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-compact-album/" rel="nofollow">Basic Compact Album</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-extended-album/" rel="nofollow">Basic List Album</a></p>
<p><strong>INTRODUCING NEXTGEN GALLERY PRO.</strong> NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro are premium WordPress gallery plugin extensions for NextGEN Gallery that add new photo gallery displays, lightboxes, ecommerce, proofing, and pro support. Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro photo plugin features.</a></p>
<p><strong>Demos</strong><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-mosaic-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Mosaic Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-masonry-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Masonry Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-filmstrip-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Filmstrip Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-film-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Film Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-slideshow-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Slideshow Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-thumbnail-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Thumbnail Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-blogstyle-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Blog Style Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-grid-album/" rel="nofollow">Pro Grid Albums</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-list-album/" rel="nofollow">Pro List Album</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-lightbox-demo/" rel="nofollow">Pro Lightbox Demo</a> (full screen and responsive with commenting, social sharing, and deep linking for individual images)<br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-proofing-demo/" rel="nofollow">Pro Proofing Demo</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-ecommerce-demo/" rel="nofollow">Pro Ecommerce Demo</a></p>
<h4>About Imagely</h4>
<p>NextGEN Gallery is maintained by Imagely. We&#8217;re the WordPress photography experts. In addition to NextGEN Gallery, NextGEN Plus, and NextGEN Pro, we also make Genesis WordPress themes for photographers, provide managed WordPress hosting for photographers, and run the WordPress Photography Podcast.</p>
<p>Learn more or connect with us:<br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/" rel="nofollow">Imagely Website</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-photography-themes/" rel="nofollow">Genesis WordPress Themes for Photographers</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/hosting/" rel="nofollow">Managed WordPress Hosting for Photographers</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/podcast/" rel="nofollow">The WordPress Photography Podcast</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a><br />
*<a href="https://twitter.com/imagely" rel="nofollow">Imagely on Twitter</a><br />
*<a href="https://facebook.com/imagely" rel="nofollow">Imagely on Facebook</a><br />
*<a href="https://instagram.com/imagely" rel="nofollow">Imagely on Instagram</a></p>

<h3>Shortcode</h3>
<p>NextGEN Gallery 2.x introduces our new Insert Gallery Window, which means you never need to work with shortcodes again if you would prefer not too.</p>
<p>If you do want to work with shortcodes, we&#8217;ve also introduce a new, more powerful, and more flexible shortcode system with NextGEN Gallery 2.0.</p>
<p><strong><a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery-shortcodes/" rel="nofollow">Learn About NextGEN Gallery Shortcodes</a></strong></p>
<p>For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1386:"<p>INSTALLATION: The easiest way to start uploading your photos is to login to you WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins &gt;&gt; Add New, search for NextGEN Gallery, and click to install. You can also download the zip file from this page and upload it from the Plugins &gt;&gt; Add New &gt; Upload page.</p>
<p>HOW TO USE: Just go to a page or post and click the NextGEN Gallery icon. From our Insert Gallery Window, you can create, manage, customize, and display your photo galleries. You can also manage your photo galleries and gallery settings from the central options area under the &#8220;Gallery&#8221; tab on your dashboard menu.</p>
<p>DOCUMENTATION: See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>That&#8217;s it &#8230; have fun! For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/qwNr5ZNGavo?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
";s:3:"faq";s:4977:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>INSTALLATION: The easiest way to start uploading your photos is to login to you WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins &gt;&gt; Add New, search for NextGEN Gallery, and click to install. You can also download the zip file from this page and upload it from the Plugins &gt;&gt; Add New &gt; Upload page.</p>
<p>HOW TO USE: Just go to a page or post and click the NextGEN Gallery icon. From our Insert Gallery Window, you can create, manage, customize, and display your photo galleries. You can also manage your photo galleries and gallery settings from the central options area under the &#8220;Gallery&#8221; tab on your dashboard menu.</p>
<p>DOCUMENTATION: See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>That&#8217;s it &#8230; have fun! For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/qwNr5ZNGavo?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
</p>
<h4>Why are my photo galleries not opening up in a lightbox after I move my site?</h4>
<p>
<p>This is often due to the URL paths to the CSS and JavaScript files used by the Lightbox Effects not being changed to relevant addresses based on the new site. This article will help sort out this issue if that is the case: <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/galleries-opening-lightbox/" rel="nofollow">Why are my galleries not opening up in a lightbox?</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Do you have documentation or tutorials?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will NextGEN Gallery work with my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Part of what makes the NextGEN Gallery WordPress gallery plugin so popular is its flexibility &#8211; it works with the vast majority of premium and free themes, without requiring any coding.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the photo galleries flash based?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, NextGEN Gallery uses Javascript and jQuery based displays to ensure compatibility across the widest range of displays possible.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the galleries mobile friendly?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, since we use Javascript rather than flash, NextGEN Gallery is compatible with Android, iOS, and Blackberry. As of July 2013, all photo galleries are responsive. NextGEN Pro also includes a full screen, responsive Pro Lightbox with mobile gesture support.</p>
</p>
<h4>What is the difference between a gallery and an album?</h4>
<p>
<p>In the simplest of terms, Galleries contain your photos and Albums contain your Galleries. Albums act as links and placeholders to quickly and easily navigate your galleries &#8211; Galleries will actually display your images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I upload multiple images at once?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can batch upload entire photo galleries at one time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I password protect galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WordPress allows you to password protect pages by default &#8211; which includes all photo galleries and content for the entire page. Password protection of pages can be turned on and off at any time, with just a few clicks.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add a watermark to the photos/slideshows?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can add text or image watermarks to your gallery images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I crop thumbnails?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, each thumbnail image can be individually adjusted to suit your needs.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is there pagination for photo galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, and you can adjust the amount of images to be shown on a page at any time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I customize the lightbox?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, the lightbox can be configured with multiple options directly from the Dashboard, and there are multiple CSS styles which can be applied and modified as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add HTML to the captions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, caption areas are fully HMTL capable.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add an external links to galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Since the captions are fully HTML capable, you can add external links and any other type of mark up you wish.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is NextGEN Gallery available in foreign languages?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, the NextGEN Gallery WordPress gallery plugin has been translated into dozens of languages &#8211; <a href="https://www.imagely.com/languages/" rel="nofollow">click here to find out more.</a></p>
</p>
<h4>More Information</h4>
<p>
<p>For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that the plugin works when PHP isn&#8217;t compiled against libxml</li>

<h4>V2.2.9 &#8211; 06.14.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   WSOD caused by setting $wp_query-&gt;is_page to false</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.8 &#8211; 06.13.2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Removed custom Freemius opt-in message</li>
<li>Changed: New design and video for Upgrade to Pro page</li>
<li>Changed: Added namespacing to NGG-generated transients</li>
<li>Fixed:   Better error reporting for the XML-RPC method, ngg.uploadImage</li>
<li>Fixed:   Thumbnail editing links missing when locale uses RTL language such as Hebrew</li>
<li>Fixed:   Roles and Capabilities discrepancy with displaying NextGEN Gallery UI elements</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fancybox lightbox effect not compatible with Pro Mosaic galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic Tagcloud does not honor display type setting when editing in IGW</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic Tagcloud allows selection of Pro display types when NGG Pro is disabled</li>
<li>Fixed:   Limit display types available in &#8220;Display galleries as&#8221; setting for albums</li>
<li>Fixed:   Special characters in <code>show_slideshow_text</code> parameter causing inserted display to not be editable.</li>
<li>Fixed:   NGG Basic Slideshow not honoring transition effect setting</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image tags that are no longer should be removed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Spacing preserved when our shortcodes are placed with other content</li>
<li>Fixed:   Breadcrumbs in albums when slug is shared between gallery and album</li>
<li>Fixed:   get_unique_slug() creating invalid SQL query when gallery name contains quote characters</li>
<li>Fixed:   /ngg_tags pages displaying comments from all posts</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP warning when saving image meta data</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix incompatibility with WPML pagination due to overriding $_SERVER[&#8216;REQUEST_URI&#8217;]</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   IGW placeholder images aren&#8217;t used by WordPress SEO&#8217;s OpenGraph analysis</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.43 &#8211; 05.25.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added Freemius integration</li>
<li>NEW:     Added actions actions ngg_updated_image_meta, ngg_recovered_image, ngg_generated_image, ngg_moved_images, and ngg_copied_images</li>
<li>NEW:     Added patch from WPML copyping ATP galleries to new language pages when duplicating a page to a new language</li>
<li>Changed: Moved &#8216;ngg_delete_picture&#8217; action to before the image has been removed</li>
<li>Changed: Now prevent maximum_entity_count from being set to 0 or lower in Other Options</li>
<li>Changed: Updated &#8220;Roots&#8221; relative url support to re-branded &#8220;Soil&#8221; relative url</li>
<li>Changed: Updated branding so all publicly visible instances of &#8220;Photocrati&#8221; are now &#8220;Imagely&#8221;</li>
<li>Changed: Upgraded FontAwesome to 4.6.1</li>
<li>Fixed:   Album breadcrumbs when used with legacy templates</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with added WP role objects without a remove_cap() method</li>
<li>Fixed:   Default watermark setting causing images to be watermarked by text even though &#8220;image&#8221; is shown chosen on &#8220;Other Options&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed:   Navigating to albums with UTF8 characters in their name</li>
<li>Fixed:   Replaced use of get_currentuserinfo() with wp_get_current_user()</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.33 &#8211; 04.25.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with themes and plugins which enqueue underscore.js in the head of the document</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that shutter reloaded can find its image assets</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.31 &#8211; 04.05.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added constant NGG_SCRIPT_VERSION that is either the plugin version or rand() should SCRIPT_DEBUG be on</li>
<li>NEW:     Added warning when saving galleries and refuse to automatically delete galleries with one or more &#8220;../&#8221; in their path.</li>
<li>Changed: ATP slug field disallow several characters (spaces, ?, |, &amp;, [, ]) by replacing them with dashes as they are typed</li>
<li>Changed:     Made get_static_url() look in the WP_CONTENT/ngg/(module_name)/static directory for CSS/JS overrides</li>
<li>Fixed:   Bug introduced in 2.1.24 allowing gallery paths &amp; slugs to contain spaces; galleries must be &#8220;saved&#8221; once to correct them</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with WPML String Translation when uploading images without title or description</li>
<li>Fixed:   Made get_image_url() encode gallery directory names &#8216;because%this%is&#8217; a valid directory</li>
<li>Fixed:   Manage Galleries &gt; Search results not saving when edited</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser gallery templates not using AJAX pagination when enabled</li>
<li>Fixed:   Resource manager breaking the layout of the Multisite Plugin Activation page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Static url generation when the nextgen-gallery directory is a symlink outside of the WordPress roots</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.27 &#8211; 03.16.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:    Formatting issues with changelog</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.26 &#8211; 03.15.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:    Removed unnecessary whitespace from &#8220;Related images&#8221; template that caused issues with some themes</li>
<li>Fixed:    Detection of parents from grand-child-albums when generating breadcrumbs</li>
<li>Fixed:    C_Router-&gt;initialize() generating warnings with WP-CLI or the WP-CLI-Cron</li>
<li>Fixed:    Added Roots-theme relative-url support to C_MVC_Router-&gt;get_static_url()</li>
<li>Fixed:    nggdb::get_unique_slug() not generating unique slugs</li>
<li>Fixed:    Album breadcrumbs CSS compatibility with certain themes</li>
<li>Fixed:    C_Gallery-&gt;validation() not working properly when sanitizing gallery title using UTF-8</li>
<li>Fixed:    NGG&#8217;s cross-frame-communication cookies not being purged</li>
<li>Fixed:    Updated C_Dynamic_Thumbnails_Manager-&gt;get_uri_from_params() with user-submitted patch</li>
<li>Fixed:    Updated C_CustomPost_DataMapper_Driver-&gt;_save_entity() with user-submitted patch</li>
<li>Fixed:    Cleaned up overview.php&#8217;s readability and removed some now-long-unused code from legacy&#8217;s ajax.php</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.23 &#8211; 01.05.2015</h4>

<li>Secured: Ability to browse and import gallery folders</li>

<li>Fixed:   Order direction not honored on Manage Galleries page</li>
<li>Fixed:   _NGG_Galleries_List_Table compatibility with WordPress 4.3+</li>

<li>Fixed:   Problem deleting interframe communication cookies</li>

<li>Changed: Made Add Gallery/Images notifications a link to the gallery</li>

<li>Changed: Updated widgets to use PHP5 parent::__construct() over $this-&gt;WP_Widget()</li>
<li>Fixed:   C_NextGen_Metadata-&gt;get_EXIF() was bugged with imagebrowser-exif template</li>

<li>Fixed:   Setting post thumbnail more than once on a page/post</li>
<li>Fixed:   Permanently hide gallery types from ATP without an active POPE module</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   Fixed typo in nggallery.po</li>
<li>Fixed:   Cache results of lookup_columns() to avoid multiple identical queries; thanks go to Alex Bradaric</li>
<li>Fixed:   Better WP-CPI detection</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed unnecessary calls to parent::initialize()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted album-compact template to always include p.ngg-album-gallery-image-counter</li>
<li>Fixed:   Replaced empty gallery rendering in is_feed() with a link</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed default settings for imagerotator, which is no longer supported</li>
<li>Fixed:   Optimized scanning of images and photos when importing a gallery</li>
<li>Fixed:   When a gallery is deleted, ensure that DB and filesystem are purged</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed Insert Gallery Window box shadow</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that file_exists() calls are prefixed with @</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.0 &#8211; 05.18.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Album breadcrumbs and pagination</li>
<li>NEW:     Ability to override builtin MVC templates</li>
<li>NEW:     Robust transient management</li>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to set post thumbnails via XML-RPC module</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8216;ngg_get_image_size_params&#8217; filter to control image generation</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8216;ngg_basic_tagcloud_title&#8217; and &#8216;ngg_basic_tagcloud_excluded_display_types&#8217; filters</li>
<li>NEW:     Added ngg_manage_images_items_per_page filter</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8220;ngg_get_image_url&#8221; filter</li>
<li>NEW:     Including Ukranian and Polish translations</li>
<li>NEW:     The ability to set template in gallery widgets</li>
<li>Changed: Default thumbnail dimensions set to 240&#215;160</li>
<li>Changed: Product now adheres to Pope 0.12 and provides get_modules_to_load()</li>
<li>Changed: Updated translations</li>
<li>Changed: Removed link to capsman plugin in Roles accordion</li>
<li>Changed: Taxnomies now use internationalized strings</li>
<li>Changed: Image date/time meta data fields are stored as UNIX timestamps</li>
<li>Secured: Uploading zips</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various PHP warnings and notices</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility fixes for WPML</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that backup image functionality fails gracefully</li>
<li>Fixed:   WP option &#8216;ngg_do_upgrade&#8217; updated in every HTTP request</li>
<li>Fixed;   Empty $_SERVER[&#8216;PATHINFO&#8217;] causing multiple routing issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   &#8220;Manage Galleries&#8221; display image alttext in the filename column</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various issues with the tag cloud display type</li>
<li>Fixed:   Integrity check when updating from 1.9.x</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image filenames substituting spaces for + which is only proper in the query string</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery Window not working with nested levels of gzip compression</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser as lightbox effect not working with pagination</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with MultiVerso Advanced File Sharing</li>
<li>Fixed:   &#8220;Add page&#8221; button not displaying on the next immediate page load</li>
<li>Fixed:   Double-escaping of non-latin characters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser pagination with custom templates</li>
<li>Fixed:   Custom CSS is enqueued late to ensure it&#8217;s one of the last stylesheets loaded</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed watermarking PNG images</li>
<li>Fixed:   Using the &#8220;Import Metadata&#8221; bulk action overwrites existing data</li>
<li>Fixed:   Seconds were not retained from CaptureTime EXIF field</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflicts created by our TinyMCE plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image mapper setting gid to gallery name, not the unique ID</li>
<li>Fixed:   Restored nggdb-&gt;get_random_images(), nggdb-&gt;search_for_file, and nggdb-&gt;find_all_albums()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow gallery slug as parameter to nggdb::get_gallery()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t minify Plupload&#8217;s i18n JavaScript</li>
<li>Fixed:   Custom template images not being given their full effect code attributes</li>
<li>Fixed:   When importing galleries from folders, allow symlinks</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use of C_Gallery_Mapper in C_Image_Wrapper</li>
<li>Fixed:   Properly handle themes that don&#8217;t call wp_footer() or wp_print_footer_scripts()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning about missing style.php file on Network Admin -&gt; Gallery page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning about getimagesize() failure when backing up an image or photo</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.0.71 &#8211; 02.19.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Module files are compiled into a single package file to reduce disk I/O</li>
<li>NEW:     All CSS stylesheets and Javascript source files are minified to reduce latency</li>
<li>NEW:     All photo lightboxes are configured using an in-memory management class.</li>
<li>NEW:     Uses Pope 2.0, benefiting from the new caching capabilities</li>
<li>NEW:     NextGEN Gallery&#8217;s functionality is disabled if NextGEN Pro is incompatible</li>
<li>NEW:     Added ngg_effect_code filter</li>
<li>Changed: Updated FontAwesome to 4.3.0</li>
<li>Changed: Updated select2 to 3.5.2</li>
<li>Changed: Removed PicLens / CoolIris gallery integration</li>
<li>Changed: Removed JSON API. Please use XML-RPC API instead</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache FS &amp; url lookups/calculations</li>
<li>Changed: Greatly reduced the # of sql queries, and eliminated anything redundant</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache datamapper and SQL queries</li>
<li>Changed: Don&#8217;t enqueue scripts or styles unless we require them</li>
<li>Changed: Reduce the number of resources we enqueue for every HTTP request</li>
<li>Changed: Ngg_Store now uses cookies instead of localStorage</li>
<li>Changed: Insert Gallery Window is routed using wp-admin/admin_init</li>
<li>Changed: Removed unused code from ngglegacy module. Created wrappers for commonly-used functions</li>
<li>Changed: LZW module removed</li>
<li>Changed: Legacy gallery template drop-down selection now using select2</li>
<li>Secured: Restrict folder browsing to NGG_IMPORT_ROOT constant</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with PHP&#8217;s transparent ZLIB compression</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser as lightbox effect not working when non-default permalink slug used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Angled quotations marks used in shortcode parameters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility between ImageBrowser gallery and TwentyFifteen theme</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow pagination to retain query string url parameters when linking to other pages</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed pagination issues with slideshow galleries displayed as thumbnails</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix C_GalleryStorage_Driver_Base-&gt;import_gallery_from_fs() not checking imgBackup</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed problem with default settings being applied multiple times</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fallback to &#8220;full&#8221; image / photo sizes if &#8220;backup&#8221; images aren&#8217;t available</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use M_DataMapper&#8217;s serialization methods throughout the codebase</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict with WordPress SEO and get_the_excerpt() call</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t run Resource Manager on wp-login.php or wp-sign.php</li>
<li>Fixed:   TinyMCE Image Editor conflict with Insert Gallery Window placeholder images/photos</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix Shutter positioning when admin bar is displayed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow deselection of a legacy gallery template</li>
<li>Fixed:   Prevent conflicts when using imagebrowser gallery as a lightbox effect</li>
<li>Fixed:   Pagination not working for slideshow galleries using thumbnail integration</li>
</ul>

<li>Changed: Basic Albums templates now given the image counter P element the class &#8216;ngg-album-gallery-image-counter&#8217; (by user request)</li>
<li>Changed: Gallery widgets now apply height:auto to their element; fixes compatibility with some themes</li>
<li>Changed: Random galleries should be substantially faster now (1000% or more for large image tables)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Complete WPML compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed:   Disable Buddypress &#8216;bp_do_redirect_canonical&#8217; filter as it ruins our routing system</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use plugins_url() content_url() when appropriate rather than just site_url() and home_url()</li>
<li>Fixed:   WP Cron job will remove not only displayed gallery transients, but rendering transients as well</li>
<li>Fixed:   NGG_RENDERING_CACHE_TTL constant is honored properly</li>
<li>Fixed:   If using the caption template for Basic Thumbnails, only show the image caption when appropriate</li>
<li>Fixed:   If NGG is uninstalled, so are it&#8217;s custom capabilities</li>
<li>Fixed:   Translate &#8220;Attach NextGEN Gallery to Post&#8221; ATP icon alt text when translations are active</li>
<li>Fixed:   Multisite gallery path tooltip gave a wrong default setting</li>
<li>Fixed:   Flush &#8216;all&#8217; caches when pope_module_list setting changes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t enqueue related images css in the admin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic Slideshows fixes WP creating extraneous P element above the slideshow display</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic Singlepic will now display images/photos marked &#8216;excluded&#8217; in the admin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Admin pages can now update when the &#8220;Save&#8221; button text has been translated</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.0.59 &#8211; 03.18.2014</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Separated pope_module_list from ngg_options record in options table</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed code causing jQuery compatibility issues in WP Admin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow third-parties to override jQuery with Google&#8217;s CDN</li>
<li>Fixed:   When resetting the &#8216;jquery&#8217; handle, ensure that jquery-migrate is a dependency</li>
<li>Fixed:   Silenced many PHP warnings</li>
<li>Fixed:   Datamapper-&gt;count() not returning the correct count</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with Gravity Forms</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.58 &#8211; 03.09.2014</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Reset jQuery to WP defaults when modified by a third-party</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with WP jQuery Lightbox plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with Peekaboo theme</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.57 &#8211; 03.05.2014</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Re-introduced the Reset button</li>
<li>NEW:     Tooltip added for Page Link to functionality</li>
<li>NEW:     Displayed Gallery Triggers moved from NextGEN Pro to NextGEN Gallery (not in use)</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_Store, a client-side persistence layer (not in use)</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_CRON_SCHEDULE constant. Set to the number of seconds between the execution of NextGEN Gallery cron jobs</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_RENDERING_CACHE_TTL constant. TTL measured in seconds.</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_DISPLAYED_GALLERY_CACHE_TTL constant. TTL measured in seconds.</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_DISABLE_LEGACY_SHORTCODES constant. When TRUE, [slideshow] becomes [nggslideshow].</li>
<li>NEW:     Added Font Awesome, available for NextGEN Gallery extensions</li>
<li>Changed: Transients are removed every 30 minutes instead of 60 minutes</li>
<li>Changed: Admin Page &amp; Form components refactored to allow custom POST processing</li>
<li>Changed: Default path for NEW multisite installations to wp-content/uploads/sites/%BLOG_ID%/nggallery/</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to upload ZIP files for photos and galleries on Windows hosts</li>
<li>Fixed:   Support for filenames with non-ASCII characters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Dynamic updates in the Insert Gallery Window (interframe communication)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery Window freezing in IE11</li>
<li>Fixed:   Path issues on Windows Servers</li>
<li>Fixed:   Module installer integrity</li>
<li>Fixed:   Database query performance. No more joins to the WP options table</li>
<li>Fixed:   Lightboxes storing absolute paths for static resources</li>
<li>Fixed:   Displayed gallery cache not regularly flushed</li>
<li>Fixed:   SQL query performance problems. Honor max_packet_allowed variable for MySQL</li>
<li>Fixed:   Multiple database queries generated for determining next available image slug</li>
<li>Fixed:   Corrupted MediaRSS feeds</li>
<li>Fixed:   Padding on Gallery Settings and Other Options pages</li>
<li>Fixed:   Routing issues on subdirectory installs</li>
<li>Fixed:   Importing photo galleries using the Insert Gallery Window</li>
<li>Fixed:   Gallery path calculations on Windows web servers</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sub-album urls not processed correctly</li>
<li>Fixed:   Apply maximum entity count to existing displayed galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   NextGEN Gallery Thumbnail Widget shouldn&#8217;t use ImageBrowser gallery effect</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to set shuffle parameter for ImageRotator slideshow galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP warning about HTMLDocument when displaying a SinglePic photo</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sanitization of photo gallery title</li>
<li>Fixed:   Home URL now used instead of Site URL in MediaRSS feed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery Window broken when WPML is installed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery Window instructing browser to cache the page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Photo watermarking not working in low-memory environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Maximum images limit not being applied for galleries already created.</li>
<li>Fixed:   Double forward slashes in static urls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t sleep when checking if the installer is running</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t enforce Pope interface contracts</li>
<li>Fixed:   Remove custom table extra records from wp_options table</li>
<li>Fixed:   Scan folder for new images not working</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incorrect page permalink used for &#8220;Page Link To&#8221; functionality</li>
<li>Fixed:   Pagination broken when Basic Thumbnail gallery on the same page as Basic Album</li>
<li>Fixed:   parse_url() warnings generated for PHP 5.3.3 and earlier</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with Headway Themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with web servers which don&#8217;t provide PHP a document root</li>
<li>Fixed:   Third-party incompatibilities caused by the Photocrati Resource Manager</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with the Flattr plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with the Weaver II theme</li>
<li>Fixed:   Interface tweaks for WordPress 3.8</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.40 &#8211; 11.26.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to apply lightbox effects to non-NGG images</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_HIDE_STRICT_ERRORS constant. Define and set to TRUE to hide strict errors</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_IMPORT_ROOT constant. Define and set to TRUE to browse from a custom directory</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_DEBUG constant. Define and set to TRUE to display helpful messages for debugging</li>
<li>NEW:     Each custom table record will have an associated custom post record for expansion</li>
<li>NEW:     Display helpful error messages for image and photo upload issues</li>
<li>NEW:     Add data-(src|thumbnail|image-id|title|description) attribute to gallery image anchors</li>
<li>NEW:     Variant support for photo gallery sources. Random images is limited to 5 variations</li>
<li>Fixed:   Excessive creation of transients for random galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Some issues interfering with photo and gallery uploads</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with NextGEN Gallery Export Plugin for Adobe Lightroom (thanks Vladimir!)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sorting photos in the Insert Gallery Window interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   HTML allowed in gallery/album descriptions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Requests for photo galleries within albums that have numeric names are broken</li>
<li>Fixed:   Call to a non-member function get() on WP_Query</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to sort by Image ID in the Insert Gallery Window</li>
<li>Fixed:   Isolate the Insert Gallery Window from implicit third-party script inclusion</li>
<li>Fixed:   Check for the existance of thumbnails when generating urls, and if missing, generate new ones</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with NextGEN Facebook OpenGraph+ plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various XML-RPC issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   Gallery widget stylesheet not included</li>
<li>Fixed:   Issue with color not being pre-selected when previewing Watermark</li>
<li>Fixed:   E_NOTICE emitted when cleaning up cached image files</li>
<li>Fixed:   E_NOTICE emitted when viewing gallery type settings</li>
<li>Fixed:   Typo adjusting pcre.backtrack_limit for shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Content within the tabs of the Insert Gallery Window cut-off</li>
<li>Fixed:   Routing problem which would cause conflicts with different gallery types on the same page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Broken Dynamic CSS links on GoDaddy</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to use HTML in gallery/album descriptions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sub-album requests conflicting with paginated galleries on the same page</li>
<li>Merged:  Pull request from andreasE (https://bitbucket.org/photocrati/nextgen-gallery/pull-request/6/)</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   Related images heading only added when Related Images functionality is enabled</li>

<li>Fixed:   AJAX handling is third-party compatible</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image date is no longer overwritten when a photo is modified</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed issue with displayed galleries using source=&#8217;tags&#8217;</li>
<li>Fixed:   Problem with transient cache not getting flushed properly from Other Options page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use correct gallery/transient ID when ajax pagination is used</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   Enqueuing AJAX JS libraries twice in wp-admin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Encoding issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP warnings caused by accessing unserialized data as array</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed installer issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.7 &#8211; 08.09.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     New resource manager that fixes some plugin and theme incompatibilities</li>
<li>NEW:     Styles (custom stylesheets) should reside in wp-content/ngg_styles</li>
<li>NEW:     Added option to &#8220;Other Options -&gt; Misc&#8221; to control maximum images returned</li>
<li>Secured: Removed default connector for jQuery FileTree library</li>
<li>Changed: Updated the simplehtmldom library to version 1.5</li>
<li>Changed: jQuery is now enqueued at the beginning of every request</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with BuddyPress</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with Events+, bbPress, Custom Permalinks, and other plugins</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompcatibilities with Member Access, AMember, Magic Fields, and More Fields</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with Elegant Themes, Oxygen, Responsive, and some other themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that gallery images and photos don&#8217;t have a border by default</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict between imagebrowser gallery and album urls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Reverted default gallerypath to wp-content/gallery/</li>
<li>Fixed:   Upgrade-safe way of overriding Styles</li>
<li>Fixed:   Generation of AJAX url is now based on slug</li>
<li>Fixed:   Restore nggShowGallery and nggShowSlideshow as wrappers to new API</li>
<li>Fixed:   Always use domain as specified by WordPress Site URL</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use WordPress Home URL over Site URL when appropriate</li>
<li>Fixed:   Numerous gallery pagination issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted our forms to comply with WordPress Firewalls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Correct use of select2 DOM selector for maximum compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed:   Path and URL calculations for Windows and UNIX environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that pluggable.php is loaded at the start of every request</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fancybox: adjust CSS for further box-sizing protection from themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use PHP 5.2.1 compatible named pattern matching syntax</li>
<li>Fixed:   Remove usage of <strong>DIR</strong> constant not supported by PHP 5.2.x</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed dependency on mb_string PHP module</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow &#8220;No Lightbox&#8221; as an option for Lightbox Effects</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning: &#8220;Invalid CRT parameters detected&#8221; for Windows environments</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0 &#8211; 07.30.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Improved user experience throughout the plugin, settings and usage.</li>
<li>NEW:     Plupload queue photo uploader that allows for bulk and zip uploads within the same interface.</li>
<li>NEW:     Complete redesign of the NextGEN Gallery options panel</li>
<li>NEW:     Added new Insert Gallery Window for adding galleries from pages and posts.</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries are now mobile friendly and responsive (may need a responsive theme).</li>
<li>NEW:     Streamlined functionality for displaying galleries based on tags.</li>
<li>NEW:     Architecture based on Pope Framework (http://bitbucket.org/photocrati/pope-framework)</li>
<li>NEW:     New shortcode, “ngg_images”, and corresponding Attach to Post interface</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries have now global and instance settings</li>
<li>NEW:     Support for FastCGI environments</li>
<li>Changed: Replaces shortcodes with placeholder images, however still supports legacy shortcodes.</li>
<li>Changed: Introduced new Growl-like notifications</li>
<li>Changed: The container and it’s images are centered for slideshows</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN styles now override vs replace default styles</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN legacy templates have been deprecated (but still function)</li>
<li>FIXED:   The ability to use NextGEN image as a Featured Image.</li>
<li>FIXED:   Misc bugs and annoyances, such as PHP warnings, errors, etc.</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   Photo import date is preserved are no longer Jan 1 1970</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed mention of upgrade.php, which no longer exists</li>

<h4>V1.9.1 &#8211; 10.12.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Security hardness for untrusted filenames/meta data (THX to Brian St. Pierre)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Fixed security vulnerability (TXH to Jon Cave)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Load piclens script via other function</li>
<li>Bugfix : IE7 script fix for add gallery</li>
<li>Bugfix : IE7/IE8 width set correctly for edit album autocomplete field</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.9.0 &#8211; 27.11.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : Keep image transparency for PNG and GIF format</li>
<li>NEW : Switch to Plupload, support now HTML5 Upload (only with WordPress 3.3)</li>
<li>NEW : Added client side photo resize feature (only with WordPress 3.3)</li>
<li>NEW : Support for gallery templates in album shortcodes [ album id=x template=&#8221;name&#8221; gallery=&#8221;templatename&#8221; ]</li>
<li>NEW : Added new hook ngg_delete_picture</li>
<li>Changed : Updated to jQuery Cycle Version 2.9995</li>
<li>Changed : Always cache the single pictures, remove option</li>
<li>Bugfix : Couldn&#8217;t use bulk operation for search results</li>
<li>Bugfix : Bugfix for Edit thumbnails under IE 8 + 9</li>
<li>Bugfix : Allow empty photo altext in ngg.editImage</li>
<li>Bugfix : Various PHP notice fixes</li>
<li>Bugfix : Resize fix for Shutter effect and mobile Browser</li>
<li>Bugfix : FTP Import missing slug field into database</li>
<li>Bugfix : Check also EXIF field &#8220;DateTimeOriginal&#8221; for timestamp</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.8.4 &#8211; 26.10.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Fixed security vulnerability (TXH to Alain Schneider)</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.8.3 &#8211; 07.08.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed : Support for simple custom permalink structures (i.e. /%category%/%postname%/)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Sub-Albums in Albums didn&#8217;t create the correct link</li>
<li>Bugfix : AJAX Pagination didn&#8217;t work anymore</li>
<li>Bugfix : Adding index.php to home_url()</li>
<li>Bugfix : Preview photo lost on backend gallery page 2 or higher</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.8.2 &#8211; 12.07.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Set gallery pagination variables for search result, otherwise update failed</li>
<li>Bugfix : Update failed for paged galleries since WordPress 3.2</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.8.1 &#8211; 18.06.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Special case for pagination, instead of showing page-1, we show the clean url</li>
<li>Bugfix : Various PHP notice fixes</li>
<li>Bugfix : Typo in rewrite rules</li>
<li>Bugfix : Flush rewrite rules during upgrade later</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.8.0 &#8211; 12.06.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : Full rework of permalink url structure</li>
<li>NEW : Adding Google Sitemaps for images  and photos(require WordPress SEO plugin by YOAST )</li>
<li>NEW : Support for WPML ( WordPress Multilingual Plugin )</li>
<li>NEW : Adding support for arrow key in shutter effect (THX to Flyvans)</li>
<li>NEW : Adding sort operation for WordPress gallery plugin overview page</li>
<li>Changed : Updated pagination to new WP3.1 style</li>
<li>Bugfix : Create unique slug in a better way</li>
<li>Bugfix : Rework screen options filter for gallery and image table</li>
<li>Bugfix : Empty values in XMLRPC update calls are ignored</li>
<li>Bugfix : Create gallery failed when safe-mode on</li>
<li>Bugfix : Permalink didn&#8217;t work in combination with album &amp; imagebrowser gallery</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.7.4 &#8211; 15.02.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Disallow direct call of ajax file to avoid path disclosure (THX to High-Tech Bridge SA)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Rework jQuery Cycle slideshow for IE compat reason (THX to Justin Dickenson)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Resize only larger images or photos in slideshow</li>
<li>Bugfix : Improved image format detection in gd.thumbnail class (THX to Kupar.b)</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.7.3 &#8211; 20.01.2011</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : Introduce plugin health check for conflicts with other plugins/themes</li>
<li>NEW : Adding new XMLRPC method ngg.deleteImage</li>
<li>NEW : Adding new XMLRPC method ngg.editImage</li>
<li>Changed : Rework register script for autocomplete feature</li>
<li>Bugfix : Bugfix for Multisite setup and flash upload</li>
<li>Bugfix : WP3.1 compat issue, show site admin page only on Multisite installation</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.7.2 &#8211; 13.12.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Adding images or photos to database require slug (NOT NULL)</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.7.1 &#8211; 13.12.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed : Disable upgrade for PHP4 user</li>
<li>Changed : Disable colorpicker for option page</li>
<li>Bugfix : Compat fix for upgrade</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.7.0 &#8211; 11.12.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : Publish a new post direct from the gallery admin page</li>
<li>NEW : Added filter hook &#8216;ngg_get_image_metadata&#8217; to add more exif/iptc information</li>
<li>NEW : Adding Autocomplete field to TinyMCE Popup and Album page</li>
<li>NEW : More methods for XMLRPC interface</li>
<li>Changed : New hooks for gallery table (THX to Alexander Schneider)</li>
<li>Changed : Introduce jQuery dialog as new UI element</li>
<li>Changed : Call TinyMCE window via admin-ajax</li>
<li>Bugfix : Better support for SSL blogs</li>
<li>Bugfix : Install/Upgrade failed when table prefix contain captial letters</li>
<li>Bugfix : Fix validation issues in Media-RSS</li>
<li>Bugfix : Empty tags in XMP Meta causes PHP error</li>
<li>Bugfix : Rework load mechanism for gallery slideshow</li>
<li>Bugfix : Copy meta data when image or photo is copied</li>
<li>Bugfix : Icon Support for Ozh&#8217; Admin Drop Down Menu</li>
<li>Bugfix : Use correct sort order in gallery slideshow</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.6.2 &#8211; 19.09.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : Added constant NGG_SKIP_LOAD_SCRIPTS to avoid script load</li>
<li>Bugfix : Load Tags library with core files</li>
<li>Bugfix : Photo slideshow script failed in IE7, load script now in header</li>
<li>Bugfix : Load gallery slideshow widget always</li>
<li>Changed : New admin notice for database upgrade</li>
<li>Changed : Rework crop feature for featured images and photos</li>
<li>Changed : Use site_url() instead get_option (&#8216;siteurl&#8217;), required for SSL support</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.6.1 &#8211; 08.09.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Script load of swfobject.js failed</li>
<li>Bugfix : Show gallery sideshow also with 1 or 2 images</li>
<li>Bugfix : Rework null byte check in zip upload</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.6.0 &#8211; 07.09.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : WordPress 3.0 Network (Multi-Site) support</li>
<li>NEW : Integrate jQuery Cycle as NON-Flash photo slideshow</li>
<li>NEW : Adding jQuery File Tree for import folder (THX to Sergey Pasyuk )</li>
<li>NEW : Added action hook &#8216;ngg_show_imagebrowser_first&#8217; on custom request</li>
<li>NEW : Added filter hook &#8216;ngg_slideshow_size&#8217; to resize sildeshow for mobile browser plugins</li>
<li>Changed : Reorder tabs for upload</li>
<li>Changed : New menu icon and screen icon (THX to Ben Dunkle)</li>
<li>Changed : Load frontend libs always</li>
<li>Changed : Rework of WordPress gallery plugin overview page</li>
<li>Bugfix : Security bugfix for Zip-Upload (THX to Dominic Szablewski)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Allow JPG, PNG, GIF extension</li>
<li>Bugfix : New German translation (THX to Martin Kramarz)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Copy/Move also backup file</li>
<li>Bugfix : Calculate correct ratio for fix thumbnail size (THX to Alekz Keck)</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.5 &#8211; 14.06.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Compat issue for post thumbnails with WP2.9</li>
<li>NEW : Adding more hooks for custom fields plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.4 &#8211; 14.06.2010</h4>
<ul>

<li>Bugfix : Compat issues for Post Thumbnails under WP3.0</li>
<li>Bugfix : Esc_URL in Media RSS</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.3 &#8211; 11.04.2010</h4>

<li>Bugfix:   Remove non-breaking space from navigation</li>

<li>Bugfix:   Slideshow option &#8216;Show next image on click&#8217; has wrong default value</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.2 &#8211; 25.03.2010</h4>

</ul>
<h4>V1.5.1 &#8211; 23.03.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : PHP4 compat issue for Add gallery &amp; options page</li>

<li>Bugfix : Adding correct stripslash for gallery title</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.0 &#8211; 18.03.2010</h4>
<ul>

<li>NEW : Adding various new capabilities for user roles</li>
<li>NEW : Auto downloader for translation file</li>
<li>Changed : Rename query var from slideshow to callback for compat reason with other plugin</li>
<li>Changed : Convert widget function to new WP structure</li>
<li>Changed : Include lookup for tags into the backend search</li>
<li>Changed : Restructure addgallery and settings page to enable custom tabs</li>
<li>Bugfix : Select album preview from gallery preview pics instead random list</li>
<li>Bugfix : Keep fix dimension in edit thumbnail operation</li>
<li>Bugfix : Import meta data didn&#8217;t work correct for existing images</li>
<li>Bugfix : Fix onload bug for Chrome 4 in Shutter script</li>
<li>Bugfix : Remove various PHP notices for a better world</li>
<li>Removed : Canonical link is now part of WordPress 2.9</li>
</ul>

Thumbnails";s:4:"slug";s:21:"regenerate-thumbnails";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.2.6";s:6:"author";s:68:"<a href="http://www.viper007bond.com/">Alex Mills (Viper007Bond)</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/viper007bond";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:12:"viper007bond";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/viper007bond";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"2.8";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.6.6";s:6:"rating";d:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:245;i:4;i:15;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:4;i:1;i:13;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:278;s:15:"support_threads";i:8;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:2;s:10:"downloaded";i:4893773;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2016-07-29 12:41am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2008-08-28";s:8:"homepage";s:68:"http://www.viper007bond.com/wordpress-plugins/regenerate-thumbnails/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:591:"<p>Regenerate Thumbnails allows you to regenerate the thumbnails for your image attachments. This is very handy if you&#8217;ve changed any of your thumbnail dimensions (via Settings -&gt; Media) after previously uploading images or have changed to a theme with different featured post image dimensions.</p>
<p>You can either regenerate the thumbnails for all image uploads, individual image uploads, or specific multiple image uploads.</p>
<p>See the <a href="https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/regenerate-thumbnails/screenshots/" rel="nofollow">screenshots tab</a> for more details.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:196:"<ol>
<li>Go to your admin area and select Plugins -&gt; Add new from the menu.</li>
<li>Search for &#8220;Regenerate Thumbnails&#8221;.</li>
<li>Click install.</li>
<li>Click activate.</li>
</ol>
";s:9:"changelog";s:4128:"<h4>Version 2.2.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>PHP 7 compatibility.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Updates relating to plugin language pack support.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Better AJAX response error handling in the JavaScript. This should fix a long-standing bug in this plugin. Props Hew Sutton.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Make the capability required to use this plugin filterable so themes and other plugins can change it. Props <a href="http://jacksonwhelan.com/" rel="nofollow">Jackson Whelan</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Don&#8217;t check the nonce until we&#8217;re sure that the action called was for this plugin. Fixes lots of &#8220;Are you sure you want to do this?&#8221; error messages.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix the bottom bulk action dropdown. Thanks Stefan for pointing out the issue!</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changes to the Bulk Action functionality were made shortly before the release of WordPress 3.1 which broke the way I implemented the specific multiple image regeneration feature. This version adds to the Bulk Action menu using Javascript as that&#8217;s the only way to do it currently.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Move the <code>error_reporting()</code> call in the AJAX handler to the beginning so that we&#8217;re more sure that no PHP errors are outputted. Some hosts disable usage of <code>set_time_limit()</code> and calling it was causing a PHP warning to be outputted.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>When regenerating all images, newest images are done first rather than the oldest.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug with regeneration error reporting in some browsers. Thanks to pete-sch for reporting the error.</li>
<li>Supress PHP errors in the AJAX handler to avoid sending an invalid JSON response. Thanks to pete-sch for reporting the error.</li>
<li>Better and more detailed error reporting for when <code>wp_generate_attachment_metadata()</code> fails.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Clean up the wording a bit to better match the new features and just be easier to understand.</li>
<li>Updated screenshots.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.1.0</h4>
<p>Lots of new features!</p>
<ul>
<li>Thanks to a lot of jQuery help from <a href="http://borisschapira.com/" rel="nofollow">Boris Schapira</a>, a failed image regeneration will no longer stop the whole process.</li>
<li>The results of each image regeneration is now outputted. You can easily see which images were successfully regenerated and which failed. Was inspired by a concept by Boris.</li>
<li>There is now a button on the regeneration page that will allow you to abort resizing images for any reason. Based on code by Boris.</li>
<li>You can now regenerate single images from the Media page. The link to do so will show up in the actions list when you hover over the row.</li>
<li>You can now bulk regenerate multiple from the Media page. Check the boxes and then select &#8220;Regenerate Thumbnails&#8221; form the &#8220;Bulk Actions&#8221; dropdown. WordPress 3.1+ only.</li>
<li>The total time that the regeneration process took is now displayed in the final status message.</li>
<li>jQuery UI Progressbar version upgraded.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Switch out deprecated function call.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Directly query the database to only fetch what the plugin needs (the attachment ID). This will reduce the memory required as it&#8217;s not storing the whole row for each attachment.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>I accidentally left a <code>check_admin_referer()</code> (nonce check) commented out.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 2.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Recoded from scratch. Now uses an AJAX request per attachment to do the resizing. No more PHP maximum execution time errors or anything like that. Also features a pretty progress bar to let the user know how it&#8217;s going.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 1.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 2.7 updates &#8212; code + UI. Thanks to jdub and Patrick F.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Version 1.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Initial release.</li>
</ul>

can resize specific multiples images using the checkboxes and the "Bulk Actions" dropdown";}i:1;a:2:{s:3:"src";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails/trunk/screenshot-1.png?rev=1539894";s:7:"caption";s:42:"The plugin at work regenerating thumbnails";}}s:4:"tags";a:2:{s:9:"thumbnail";s:9:"thumbnail";s:10:"thumbnails";s:10:"thumbnails";}s:8:"versions";a:10:{s:5:"1.0.0";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.1.0.0.zip";s:5:"1.1.0";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.1.1.0.zip";s:5:"2.0.0";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.0.0.zip";s:5:"2.1.0";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.1.0.zip";s:5:"2.1.2";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.1.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.0";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.2.0.zip";s:5:"2.2.3";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.2.3.zip";s:5:"2.2.4";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.2.4.zip";s:5:"2.2.5";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.2.5.zip";s:5:"2.2.6";s:70:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/regenerate-thumbnails.2.2.6.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:35:"http://www.viper007bond.com/donate/";s:5:"icons";a:1:{s:7:"default";s:16178:"data:image/svg+xml;base64,";}}s:15:"shariff-sharing";O:8:"stdClass":25:{s:4:"name";s:21:"Shariff for WordPress";s:4:"slug";s:15:"shariff-sharing";s:7:"version";s:6:"1.0.11";s:6:"author";s:76:"<a href="http://www.heise.de">Heise Zeitschriften Verlag / Yannik Ehlert</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/yanniksde";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:9:"yanniksde";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/yanniksde";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.0";s:6:"tested";s:6:"4.2.15";s:6:"rating";d:82;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:10;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:4;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:18;s:15:"support_threads";i:0;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:20950;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2015-04-23 2:34pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-11-30";s:8:"homepage";s:117:"http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/c-t-entwickelt-datenschutzfreundliche-Social-Media-Buttons-weiter-2466687.html";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1146:"<p>This is the Shariff for WordPress plugin based on c&#8217;t Shariff.</p>
<p>For more information, check out the original <a href="https://github.com/heiseonline/shariff" rel="nofollow">GitHub project</a> and the <a href="http://ct.de/shariff" rel="nofollow">c’t information page</a>.</p>
<blockquote>
<p>Shariff enables website users to share their favorite content without compromising their privacy.</p>
<p>Facebook, Google+ and Twitter supply official sharing code snippets which quietly siphon personal data from all page visitors. Shariff enables visitors to see how popular your page is on Facebook and share your content with others without needless data leaks.</p>
<p>Shariff <code>(/ˈʃɛɹɪf/)</code> is an open-source, low-maintenance, high-privacy solution maintained by German computer magazine c&#8217;t and heise online.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>Shariff supports sharing buttons for Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Reddit, StumbleUpon, XING, WhatsApp and mail.<br />
Select which color you want, set the button location, select the orientation fitting most to your website and set the TTL just as you want.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:246:"<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>shariff-wp</code> directory to <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code></li>
<li>Activate the plugin through th ‚Plugins‘ menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Modify the settings as you want through Settings -&gt; Shariff</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:698:"
<h4>How do I hide Shariff on a page?</h4>
<p>
<p><strong>Method A:</strong> Edit the article and check <code>Deactivate Shariff?</code>.</p>
<p><strong>Method B:</strong> Include <code>hideshariff</code> in the article. The word will be removed automatically and Shariff will not be shown. If you want to write hidesharrif in an article without removing Shariff, just write <code>/hideshariff</code>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Shariff doesn&#8217;t show any numbers</h4>
<p>
<p>Your user probably doesn&#8217;t have the right to write to the default temp folder <code>/tmp</code>. Then create a new folder and use it as temp folder in the Shariff settings, make sure that the rights are set correct.</p>
</p>

1.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.2";s:66:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wf-cookie-consent.1.1.2.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:60:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wf-cookie-consent.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:26:"https://www.wunderfarm.com";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:70:"https://ps.w.org/wf-cookie-consent/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1330603";s:2:"2x";s:70:"https://ps.w.org/wf-cookie-consent/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1330603";}}s:13:"wordpress-seo";O:8:"stdClass":25:{s:4:"name";s:9:"Yoast SEO";s:4:"slug";s:13:"wordpress-seo";s:7:"version";s:5:"5.0.2";s:6:"author";s:43:"<a href="https://yoast.com/">Team Yoast</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/joostdevalk";s:12:"contributors";a:6:{s:7:"atimmer";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/atimmer";s:8:"jipmoors";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/jipmoors";s:11:"joostdevalk";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/joostdevalk";s:9:"omarreiss";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/omarreiss";s:9:"tacoverdo";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/tacoverdo";s:5:"yoast";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/yoast";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.6";s:6:"tested";s:3:"4.8";s:6:"rating";d:96;s:7:"ratings";a:6:{i:5;i:13237;i:4;i:375;i:3;i:108;i:2;i:77;i:1;i:420;i:0;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:14218;s:15:"support_threads";i:347;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:274;s:10:"downloaded";i:54395198;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-07-13 1:01pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-10-11";s:8:"homepage";s:102:"https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/#utm_source=wpadmin&utm_medium=plugin&utm_campaign=wpseoplugin";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:11268:"<p>WordPress out of the box is already technically quite a good platform for SEO. This was true when Joost wrote his original <a href="https://yoast.com/articles/wordpress-seo/" rel="nofollow">WordPress SEO</a> article in 2008 (updated every few months) and it&#8217;s still true today, but that doesn&#8217;t mean you can&#8217;t improve it further! This plugin is written from the ground up by Joost de Valk and his team at <a href="https://yoast.com/" rel="nofollow">Yoast</a> to improve your site&#8217;s SEO on <em>all</em> needed aspects. While this <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO plugin</a> goes the extra mile to take care of all the technical optimization, more on that below, it first and foremost helps you write better content.  Yoast SEO forces you to choose a focus keyword when you&#8217;re writing your articles, and then makes sure you use that focus keyword everywhere.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Premium Support</strong><br />
  The Yoast team does not always provide active support for the Yoast SEO plugin on the WordPress.org forums. One-on-one email support is available to people who bought the <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo-premium/" rel="nofollow">Premium Yoast SEO plugin</a> only.<br />
  Note that the Premium SEO plugin has several extra features too, including the option to have multiple focus keywords and a redirect manager, so it might be well worth your investment!</p>
<p>You should also check out the <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/local-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast Local SEO</a>, <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/news-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast News SEO</a> and <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/video-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast Video SEO</a> extensions to Yoast SEO. These of course come with support too.</p>
<p><strong>Bug Reports</strong><br />
  Bug reports for Yoast SEO are <a href="https://github.com/Yoast/wordpress-seo" rel="nofollow">welcomed on GitHub</a>. Please note GitHub is <em>not</em> a support forum, and issues that aren&#8217;t properly qualified as bugs will be closed.</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Write better content with Yoast SEO</h4>
<p>Using the snippet preview, you can see a rendering of what your post or page will look like in the search results, whether your title is too long or too short, and whether your meta description makes sense in the context of a search result. This way the plugin will help you not only increase rankings but also increase the click through rate for organic search results.</p>
<h4>Page Analysis</h4>
<p>The Yoast SEO plugins <a href="https://yoast.com/content-seo-wordpress-linkdex/" rel="nofollow">Page Analysis</a> functionality checks simple things you&#8217;re bound to forget. It checks, for instance, if you have images in your post and whether they have an alt tag containing the focus keyword for that post. It also checks whether your posts are long enough, whether you&#8217;ve written a meta description and if that meta description contains your focus keyword, if you&#8217;ve used any subheadings within your post, etc. etc.</p>
<p>The plugin alsgruo allows you to write meta titles and descriptions for all your category, tag and custom taxonomy archives, giving you the option to further optimize those pages.</p>
<p>Combined, this plugin makes sure that your content is the type of content search engines will love!</p>
<h4>Technical WordPress Search Engine Optimization</h4>
<p>While out of the box WordPress is pretty good for SEO, it needs some tweaks here and there. This Yoast SEO plugin guides you through some of the settings needed, for instance by reminding you to enable pretty permalinks. But it also goes beyond that, by automatically optimizing and inserting the meta tags and link elements that Google and other search engines like so much:</p>
<h4>Meta &amp; Link Elements</h4>
<p>With the Yoast SEO plugin you can control which pages Google shows in its search results and which pages it doesn&#8217;t show. By default, it will tell search engines to index all of your pages, including category and tag archives, but to only show the first pages in the search results. It&#8217;s not very useful for a user to end up on the third page of your &#8220;personal&#8221; category, right?</p>
<p>WordPress itself only shows canonical link elements on single pages, but Yoast SEO makes it output canonical link elements everywhere. Google has recently announced they would also use <code>rel="next"</code> and <code>rel="prev"</code> link elements in the <code>head</code> section of your paginated archives. This plugin adds those automatically. See <a href="https://yoast.com/rel-next-prev-paginated-archives/" rel="nofollow">this post</a> for more info.</p>
<h4>XML Sitemaps</h4>
<p>The Yoast SEO plugin has the most advanced XML Sitemaps functionality in any WordPress plugin. Once you check the box, it automatically creates XML sitemaps and notifies Google &amp; Bing of the sitemaps&#8217; existence. These XML sitemaps include the images in your posts &amp; pages too, so that your images may be found better in the search engines too.</p>
<p>These XML Sitemaps will even work on large sites, because of how they&#8217;re created, using one index sitemap that links to sub-sitemaps for each 1,000 posts. They will also work with custom post types and custom taxonomies automatically, while giving you the option to remove those from the XML sitemap should you wish to.</p>
<p>Because of using <a href="https://yoast.com/xsl-stylesheet-xml-sitemap/" rel="nofollow">XSL stylesheets for these XML Sitemaps</a>, the XML sitemaps are easily readable for the human eye too, so you can spot things that shouldn&#8217;t be in there.</p>
<h4>RSS Optimization</h4>
<p>Are you being outranked by scrapers? Instead of cursing at them, use them to your advantage! By automatically adding a link to your RSS feed pointing back to the original article, you&#8217;re telling the search engine where they should be looking for the original. This way, the Yoast SEO plugin increases your own chance of ranking for your chosen keywords and gets rid of scrapers in one go!</p>
<h4>Breadcrumbs</h4>
<p>If your theme is compatible, and themes based on for instance Genesis or by WooThemes often are, you can use the built-in Breadcrumbs functionality. This allows you to create an easy navigation that is great for both users and search engines, and will support the search engines in understanding the structure of your site.</p>
<p>Making your theme compatible isn&#8217;t hard either, check <a href="https://kb.yoast.com/kb/implement-wordpress-seo-breadcrumbs/" rel="nofollow">these instructions</a>.</p>
<h4>Edit your .htaccess and robots.txt file</h4>
<p>Using the built-in file editor, you can edit your WordPress blog&#8217;s <code>.htaccess</code> and <code>robots.txt</code> file, giving you direct access to the two most powerful files, from an SEO perspective, in your WordPress install.</p>
<h4>Social Integration</h4>
<p>SEO and Social Media are heavily intertwined. That&#8217;s why this plugin also comes with a Facebook OpenGraph implementation and will soon also support Google+ sharing tags.</p>
<h4>Multi-Site Compatible</h4>
<p>The Yoast SEO plugin, unlike some others, is fully Multi-Site compatible. The XML Sitemaps work fine in all setups and you even have the option, in the Network settings, to copy the settings from one blog to another, or make blogs default to the settings for a specific blog.</p>
<h4>Import &amp; Export functionality</h4>
<p>If you have multiple blogs, setting up plugins like this one on all of them might seem like a daunting task. Except that it&#8217;s not, because what you can do is simple: you set up the plugin once. You then export your settings and simply import them on all your other sites. It&#8217;s that simple!</p>
<h4>Import functionality for other WordPress SEO plugins</h4>
<p>If you&#8217;ve used All In One SEO Pack or HeadSpace2 before using this plugin, you might want to import all your old titles and descriptions. You can do that easily using the built-in import functionality. There&#8217;s also import functionality for some of the older Yoast plugins, like Robots Meta and RSS footer.</p>
<p>Should you have a need to import from another SEO plugin to Yoast SEO, or from a theme like Genesis or Thesis, you can use the <a href="https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/seo-data-transporter/" rel="nofollow">SEO Data Transporter</a> plugin, which will easily convert your SEO meta data from and to a whole set of plugins like Platinum SEO, SEO Ultimate, Greg&#8217;s High Performance SEO, and themes like Headway, Hybrid, WooFramework, Catalyst etc.</p>
<p>Read <a href="https://yoast.com/all-in-one-seo-pack-migration/" rel="nofollow">this migration guide</a> if you still have questions about migrating from another SEO plugin to Yoast SEO.</p>
<h4>Yoast SEO Plugin in your Language!</h4>
<p>Currently a huge translation project is underway, translating Yoast SEO in as much as 24 languages. So far, the translations for French and Dutch are complete, but we still need help on a lot of other languages, so if you&#8217;re good at translating, please join us at <a href="http://translate.yoast.com" rel="nofollow">translate.yoast.com</a>.</p>
<h4>News SEO</h4>
<p>Be sure to also check out the premium <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/news-seo/" rel="nofollow">News SEO module</a> if you need Google News Sitemaps. It tightly integrates with Yoast SEO to give you the combined power of News Sitemaps and full Search Engine Optimization.</p>
<h4>Further Reading</h4>
<p>For more info, check out the following articles:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <a href="https://kb.yoast.com/kb/category/yoast-seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Knowledgebase</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://yoast.com/articles/wordpress-seo/" rel="nofollow">WordPress SEO &#8211; The definitive Guide by Yoast</a>.</li>
<li>Once you have great SEO, you&#8217;ll need the <a href="https://yoast.com/articles/wordpress-hosting/" rel="nofollow">best WordPress Hosting</a>.</li>
<li>The <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Plugin</a> official homepage.</li>
<li>Other <a href="https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/" rel="nofollow">WordPress Plugins</a> by the same team.</li>
<li>Follow Yoast on <a href="https://facebook.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a> &amp; <a href="http://twitter.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>From within WordPress</h3>
<ol>
<li>Visit &#8216;Plugins &gt; Add New&#8217;</li>
<li>Search for &#8216;Yoast SEO&#8217;</li>
<li>Activate Yoast SEO from your Plugins page.</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>Manually</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>wordpress-seo</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the Yoast SEO plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>After activation</h3>
<ol>
<li>You should see (a notice to start) the Yoast SEO configuration wizard.</li>
<li>Go through the configuration wizard and set up the plugin for your site.</li>
<li>You&#8217;re done!</li>
</ol>

<p>Release Date: July 13th, 2017</p>

<li>Fixes a compatibility issue with WordPress 4.6.</li>
<li>Fixes an issue where the link columns would disappear after quick-editing a post.</li>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a fatal error that could occur when trying to save a post that <a>-tags with invalid URLs in them.</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>

<li>Fixes a bug where the whip notification can be shown multiple times.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>

<ul>
<li>Introduces a module that counts links in the content.</li>
<li>Adds Flesch Reading for Italian.</li>
<li>Changes &#8216;page title&#8217; to &#8216;seo title&#8217; in the snippet preview.</li>
<li>Changes recommended maximum sentence length for Italian from 20 to 25 words, based on more in-depth research.</li>
<li>Implements the extracted version of the Algolia Search which is now present in <code>yoast-components</code>.</li>
<li>
<p>Adds a banner for the structured data course.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Under the hood</p>
</li>
<li>Introduces a database table to keep track of the linking structure. If the table cannot be created, a notification will be shown.</li>
<li>When there are posts or pages to reindex, a notice will be shown.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>
<p>Bugfixes</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where there were certain assessments missing when switching to cornerstone content.</li>

<li>Fixes a bug where the column <code>ID</code> was ambiguous, causing an SQL error.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the category URL in the sitemap was encoded twice.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where an old upgrade notice is not removed.</li>
</ul>

<li>
<p>Enhancements</p>
<ul>
<li>Removes the noodp advanced robots meta value as it is no longer used.</li>
<li>Loads the translations only when the configuration wizard endpoint is called, instead of every time <code>rest_api_init</code> is called.</li>
</ul>
</li>
