href="http://www.braekling.de">Andr&eacute; Br&auml;kling</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/braekling";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:9:"braekling";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/braekling";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.7.5";s:6:"rating";d:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:69;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:79;s:15:"support_threads";i:7;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:4;s:10:"downloaded";i:901612;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-04-19 6:03pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-06-04";s:8:"homepage";s:45:"http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-piwik/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:4515:"<p>This plugin uses the Piwik API to show your Piwik statistics in your WordPress dashboard. It&#8217;s also able to add the Piwik tracking code to your blog and to do some modifications to the tracking code. Additionally, WP-Piwik supports WordPress networks and manages multiple sites and their tracking codes.</p>
<p>To use this plugin you will need your own Piwik instance. If you do not already have a Piwik setup, you have two simple options: use either <a href="http://piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">Self-hosted</a> or <a href="http://piwik.org/hosting/" rel="nofollow">Cloud-hosted</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Requirements:</strong> PHP 7.0 (or higher), WordPress 4.0 (or higher), Piwik 3.0 (or higher)</p>
<p><strong>Languages:</strong> English, Albanian, Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil). Partially supported: Azerbaijani, Belarusian, Hindi, Lithuanian, Luxembourgish, Norwegian, Persian, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish, Ukrainian</p>
<p><strong>Note:</strong> If you vote &#8220;It&#8217;s broken&#8221;, please tell me about your problem. It&#8217;s hard to fix a bug I don&#8217;t know about! 😉</p>
<h4>What is Piwik?</h4>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/OslfF_EH81g?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span><br />
<a href="https://piwik.org/what-is-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Learn more.</a></p>
<h4>First steps</h4>
<ul>
<li>Learn how to install your own Piwik instance: <a href="https://piwik.org/docs/requirements/" rel="nofollow">Requirements</a>, <a href="https://piwik.org/docs/installation-optimization/" rel="nofollow">Installation</a>.</li>
<li>If you need support about Piwik, please have a look at the <a href="https://forum.piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">Piwik forums</a>.</li>
<li>Finally, you can start <a href="https://piwik.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/" rel="nofollow">setting up WP-Piwik</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Shortcodes</h4>
<p>You can use following shortcodes if activated:</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="overview" title="" period="day" date="yesterday"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows overview table like WP-Piwik&#8217;s overview dashboard. See Piwik API documentation on VisitsSummary.get to get more information on period and day. Multiple data arrays will be cumulated. If you fill the title attribute, its content will be shown in the table&#8217;s title.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="opt-out" language="en" width="100%" height="200px"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the Piwik opt-out Iframe. You can change the Iframe&#8217;s language by the language attribute (e.g. de for German language) and its width and height using the corresponding attributes.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="post" range="last30" key="sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the chosen keys value related to the current post. You can define a range (format: lastN, previousN or YYYY-MM-DD,YYYY-MM-DD) and the desired value&#8217;s key (e.g., sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors, nb_visits or nb_hits &#8211; for details see Piwik&#8217;s API method Actions.getPageUrl using a range).</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik]
</code></pre>
<p>is equal to <em>[wp-piwik module=&#8221;overview&#8221; title=&#8221;&#8221; period=&#8221;day&#8221; date=&#8221;yesterday&#8221;]</em>.</p>
<h4>Credits</h4>
<ul>
<li>Graphs powered by <a href="http://www.jqplot.com/" rel="nofollow">jqPlot</a> (GPL 2.0 and MIT) and and <a href="http://omnipotent.net/jquery.sparkline/" rel="nofollow">jQuery Sparklines</a> (New BSD License).</li>
<li>All translators at the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</li>
<li>Donations: Marco L., Rolf W., Tobias U., Lars K., Donna F., Kevin D., Ramos S., Thomas M., John C., Andreas G., Ben M., Myra R. I., Carlos U. R.-S., Oleg I., M. N., Daniel K., James L., Jochen K., Cyril P., Thomas K., Patrik K., Zach, Sebastian W., Peakkom, Patrik K., Kati K., Helmut O., Valerie S., Jochen D., Atlas R., Harald W., Jan M., the Piwik team itself, and all people flattering this.</li>
<li>All users who send me mails containing criticism, commendation, feature requests and bug reports &#8211; you help me to make WP-Piwik much better!</li>
</ul>
<p>Thank you all!</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:5678:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>General Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>First, you have to set up a running Piwik instance. You can get Piwik <a href="http://piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">here</a> and its documentation <a href="http://piwik.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>If you want to update your Piwik instance, you should set your WordPress blog to maintenance while the update process is running.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Install WP-Piwik on a simple WordPress blog</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload the full <code>wp-piwik</code> directory into your <code>wp-content/plugins</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Open the new &#8216;Settings/WP-Piwik Settings&#8217; menu and follow the instructions to configure your Piwik connection. Save settings.</li>
<li>If you have view access to multiple site stats and did not enable &#8220;auto config&#8221;, choose your blog and save settings again.</li>
<li>Look at &#8216;Dashboard/WP-Piwik&#8217; to see your site stats.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install WP-Piwik on a WordPress blog network (WPMU/WP multisite)</h4>
<p>There are two differents methods to use WP-Piwik in a multisite environment:<br />
* As a Site Specific Plugin it behaves like a plugin installed on a simple WordPress blog. Each user can enable, configure and use WP-Piwik on his own. Users can even use their own Piwik instances (and accordingly they have to).<br />
* Using WP-Piwik as a Network Plugin equates to a central approach. A single Piwik instance is used and the site admin configures the plugin completely. Users are just allowed to see their own statistics, site admins can see each blog&#8217;s stats.</p>
<p><em>Site Specific Plugin</em></p>
<p>Just add WP-Piwik to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable the Plugins page for individual site administrators. Each user has to enable and configure WP-Piwik on his own if he want to use the plugin.</p>
<p><em>Network Plugin</em></p>
<p>The Network Plugin support is still experimental. Please test it on your own (e.g. using a local copy of your WP multisite) before you use it in an user context.</p>
<p>Add WP-Piwik to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable it as <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network#WordPress_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Network Plugin</a>. Users can access their own statistics, site admins can access each blog&#8217;s statistics and the plugin&#8217;s configuration.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I find the Piwik URL and the Piwik auth token?</h4>
<p>
<p>To use this plugin you will need your own Piwik instance. If you do not already have a Piwik setup, you have two simple options: use either <a href="http://piwik.org/" rel="nofollow">Self-hosted</a> or <a href="http://piwik.org/hosting/" rel="nofollow">Cloud-hosted</a>.</p>
<p>As soon as Piwik works, you&#8217;ll be able to configure WP-Piwik: The Piwik URL is the same URL you use to access your Piwik, e.g. for the demo site: http://demo.piwik.org. The auth token is some kind of a secret password, which allows WP-Piwik to get the necessary data from Piwik. To get your auth token, log in to Piwik, click at the preferences gear icon (top right) and click at &#8220;API&#8221; (left sidebar menu, near the bottom).</p>
<p>You can get a more detailed description here: https://piwik.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/</p>
</p>
<h4>I get this message: &#8220;WP-Piwik was not able to connect to Piwik using our configuration&#8221;. How to proceed?</h4>
<p>
<p>First, please make sure your configuration is valid, e.g., if you are using the right Piwik URL (see description above). Then, go to the &#8220;Support&#8221; tab and run the test script. This test script will try to get some information from Piwik and shows the full response. Usually, the response output gives a clear hint what&#8217;s wrong:</p>
<p>The response output contains&#8230;<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden</strong>: WP-Piwik is not allowed to connect to Piwik. Please check your Piwik server&#8217;s configuration. Maybe you are using a password protection via .htaccess or you are blocking requests from localhost/127.0.0.1. If you aren’t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found</strong>: The Piwik URL is wrong. Try to copy &amp; paste the URL you use to access Piwik itself via browser.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and no further HTTP response code: The Piwik server does not respond. Very often, this is caused by firewall or mod_security settings. Check your server logfiles to get further information. If you aren’t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.</p>
</p>
<h4>Overview shortcode shows no unique visitors using a yearly range.</h4>
<p>
<p>See <a href="http://piwik.org/faq/how-to/#faq_113" rel="nofollow">Piwik FAQ</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Tracking does not work on HostGator!</h4>
<p>
<p>Try to enable the &#8220;avoid mod_security&#8221; option (WP-Piwik settings, Tracking tab) or create a mod_security whitelist.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I contribute to WP-Piwik as a translator?</h4>
<p>
<p>You like to contribute to WP-Piwik translations? Please use the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</p>
<p>Of course, I will add missing languages if requested, and I will also upload the existing language files of older WP-Piwik releases.</p>
<p>If you can&#8217;t (or don not want to) use transifex, you can also translate languages/wp-piwik.pot delivered with WP-Piwik.</p>
<p>Thank you very much! 🙂</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:23961:"<h4>1.0.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Allow to modify the tracked user ID using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_user_id&#8221;</li>
<li>Bugfix: Output of &#8220;post&#8221; shortcode was incorrectly placed, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/post-shortcode-values-are-incorrectly-placed/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Usage of WP_PROXY_BYPASS_HOSTS, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/bug-considering-wp_proxy_bypass_hosts-in-proxy-setups/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Proxy script did not work with cURL, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Piwik/issues/48</li>
<li>Bugfix: RSS feed tracking did not use proxy URL</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221; was extended by a site ID parameter, so it will deliver the Piwik site ID of the created site</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed an issue with Piwik site creation</li>
<li>Bugfix: Allow changes of a manually defined tracking code on networks, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Piwik/issues/46</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Readme typo fixes (thx to ujdhesa)</li>
<li>Perform your own code after site creation by using the action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221;</li>
<li>Improved caching ID to avoid interferences, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Piwik/issues/42</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.12</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed notices and warnings</li>
<li>Allow to modify the tracking code using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_code&#8221;</li>
<li>Network: Don&#8217;t show plugin overview settings link on individual sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security improvements</li>
<li>Removed some division by zero warnings</li>
<li>Option to disable SSL host verification (additional to peer verification)</li>
<li>Overview widget: Do not show unique visitors row if value is not available</li>
<li>Bugfix: Post shortcode is fixed and will work again</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security fix</li>
</ul>

</ul>
<h4>1.0.8</h4>

<li>Bugfix: Fixed user tracking (moved the user tracking changes from general modifications to runtime modifications)</li>

<li>Bugfix: Warning on blog name change, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/wp-piwik-triggers-warning-when-changing-blog-name</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.7</h4>

</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Piwik 1.11 compatibility fixes (Piwik 1.11 required now!) </li>
<li>Depending on Piwik 1.11 WP-Piwik will use async tracking now</li>
<li>CDN support added, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/request-cdn-support-1</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.8.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Warning on empty data removed (overview table)</li>
<li>Removed a possible deadlock</li>
<li>Bugfix: Apply tracking code settings everytime the tracking code is updated</li>
<li>Reset/uninstall script bugfix regarding network mode</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.5 compatibility fix: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/v35-errors-fix?replies=5 (Thanks Christian Foellmann!)</li>
<li>Advanced Search Result Analytics, see http://piwik.org/docs/javascript-tracking/#toc-tracking-internal-search-keywords-categories-and-no-result-search-keywords</li>
<li>Site Search stats added</li>
<li>Use js/index.php: Replaces piwik.js and piwik.php by js/ (instead of piwik.js only)</li>
<li>Connection timeout setting added</li>
<li>Full reset option added</li>
<li>Uninstall script added</li>
<li>Stats metaboxes: Date formatted</li>
<li>Use proxy settings defined in wp-config.php</li>
<li>Piwik.php proxy script added (see http://piwik.org/faq/how-to/#faq_132)</li>
<li>Bugfix: After upgrade, Piwik automatically places cookies again (https://wordpress.org/support/topic/after-upgrade-piwik-automatically-places-cookies-again)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Shortcodes added</li>
<li>WP-Piwik will rename sites in Piwik if site name changes in WordPress</li>
<li>Bugfix: Tracking code changes should stay active after WP-Piwik updates</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Piwik 1.9+ compatibility fix (Piwik 1.9 required!)</li>
<li>Browser version details added</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-you-attempted-to-access-the-networks-dashboard-but-you-do-not" rel="nofollow">&#8220;Create Piwik site&#8221; link (network dashboard)</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Toolbar graph bugfix</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Option: Disable SSL peer verification (REST API)</li>
<li>Option: Use own user agent</li>
<li>Test script displays additional information (e.g. response headers)</li>
<li>Using WordPress metabox concept properly</li>
<li>Bugfix: Sparkline script only loaded if required</li>
<li>Stats site supports up to 3 columns</li>
<li>Network admin stats: Choose site using a paged table (instead of a select box).</li>
<li>Feature: <a href="http://piwik.org/docs/javascript-tracking/#toc-custom-variables" rel="nofollow">Custom variables</a>, using <a href="http://wp.smashingmagazine.com/2011/10/04/create-custom-post-meta-boxes-wordpress/" rel="nofollow">custom post meta boxes</a>.</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.4 compatible (workaround)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Requires at least Piwik 1.8.2!</li>
<li>Choose between HTTP API or PHP API</li>
<li>Show graph on WordPress Toolbar</li>
<li>Add option to disable cookies &#8211; Thanks to Mathias T.!</li>
<li>Update bugfix: Upgrading from WP-Piwik 0.8.7 or less will work again</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Adding a new site will work again.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Uses $wpdb-&gt;blogs instead of $wpdb-&gt;prefix.&#8217;blogs&#8217; to keep it compatible to different database plugins</li>
<li>Bugfix: SEO dashboard widget will work even if &#8220;last 30&#8221; is selected</li>
<li>Bugfix: New created blogs won&#8217;t show &#8220;Please specify a value for &#8216;idSite&#8217;.&#8221; anymore.</li>
<li>Bugfix: New network sites without title will be created</li>
<li>Bugfix: Upgrading from old versions will work again</li>
<li>Tabbed settings</li>
<li>Debug tools added (testscript, site configuration overview and WP-Piwik reset)</li>
<li>Support forum RSS feed</li>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Optionally use of set_time_limit(0) on stats page time out</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Usage as &#8220;Site Specific Plugin&#8221; <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-as-simple-plugin-with-multisite-fills-auth-with-last-used-token" rel="nofollow">mixed up the different sites settings</a> (network mode)</li>
<li>Hotfix: Avoid &#8220;Unknown site/blog&#8221; message without giving a chance to choose an existing site. Thank you, Taimon!</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Auto-configuration</li>
<li>No code change required to enable WPMU mode anymore (Still experimental. Please create a backup before trying 0.9.0!)</li>
<li>All features in WPMU available</li>
<li>Bugfix: Removed unnecessary API calls done with each site request &#8211; Thank you, Martin B.!</li>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/no-stats-on-dashboard-new-install" rel="nofollow">No stats on dashboard</a> (sometimes this issue still occured, should be fixed now)</li>
<li>Code cleanup (still not finished)</li>
<li>Minor UI fixes</li>
<li>Minor language/gettext improvements</li>
<li>Security improvements</li>
<li>Show SEO rank stats (very slow, caching will be added in 0.9.1)</li>
<li>WordPress dashboard SEO rank widget (very slow, caching will be added in 0.9.1)</li>
<li>New option: use js/index.php</li>
<li>New option: avoid mod_security</li>
<li>Multisite: Order blog list alphabetically (Network Admin stats site)</li>
<li>Settings: Order site list alphabetically (site list shown if order conf is disabled)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>jqplot update (IE 9 compatibility) &#8211; Thank you, Martin!</li>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/no-stats-on-dashboard-new-install" rel="nofollow">No stats on dashboard</a></li>
<li>Layout fix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/stats-graph-in-dashboard-changed" rel="nofollow">Graph width on dashboard</a></li>
<li>Minor code cleanup</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>WP 3.2 compatible, metabox support</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Will also work with index.php in Piwik path</li>
<li>Bugfix: last30 dashboard widget &#8211; show correct bounce rate</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>New language files (Azerbaijani, Greek, Russian)</li>
<li>Fixed hardcoded database prefix (WPMU-Piwik)</li>
<li>Minor bugfixes: avoid some PHP warnings</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added an optional visitor chart to the WordPress dashboard</li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-multisite-update-procedure" rel="nofollow">WPMU/multisite bug</a> fixed</li>
<li>Minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Select default date (today or yesterday) shown on statistics page</li>
<li>Bugfix: Shortcut links are shown again</li>
<li>German language file update</li>
<li>Minor optical fixes (text length)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>New stats in overview box</li>
<li>WP 3.x compability fixes (capability and deprecated function warnings)</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
<li>New config handling</li>
<li>Code clean up (not finished)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Piwik 1.1+ compatibility fix</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-jscode-not-updated-when-saving-new-url-in-wpmu-mode" rel="nofollow">WPMU URL update bug</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Use load_plugin_textdomain instead of load_textdomain</li>
<li>Fixed js/css links if symbolic links are used</li>
<li>Changed experimental WPMU support to experimental WP multisite support</li>
<li>Try curl() before fopen() to avoid an <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-problems-reaching-an-ssl-installation-of-piwiki" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL bug</a></li>
<li>Added Norwegian language file by Gormer</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t worry &#8211; new features will follow soon 😉</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Using jqPlot instead of Google Chart API</li>
<li>Some facelifting</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Track 404-pages in an own category</li>
<li>Get some page (and article) details</li>
<li>Language updates</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.7.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Percent calculation fixed</li>
<li>Bugfix: Visitor chart: No label overlapping if &lt; 50 visitory/day</li>
<li>Visitor chart: Added a red unique visitor average line</li>
<li>Visitor table: Added a TOTAL stats line</li>
<li>Pie charts: Show top 9 + &#8220;others&#8221;, new color range</li>
<li>Option: Show Piwik shortcut in overview box</li>
<li>Some performance optimization</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Unnecessary debug output removed</li>
<li>German language file update</li>
<li>WordPress dashboard widget: last 30 days view added</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Click at a visitor stats day-row to load its details</li>
<li>Add stats overview to your WordPress dashboard</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added experimental WPMU support</li>
<li>Switch to disable Google Chart API</li>
<li>Added Albanian [sq] language file</li>
<li>Added Belorussian [be_BY] language file</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.5.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Display statistics to selected user roles</li>
<li>Some HTML fixes (settings page)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.4.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tracking filter added</li>
<li>Resolution stats</li>
<li>Operating System stats</li>
<li>Plugin stats</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>If allow_url_fopen is disabled in php.ini, WP-Piwik tries to use CURL instead of file_get_contents</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 2.8 compatible</li>
<li>Bugfix: Warnings on WP 2.8 plugins site</li>
<li>Dashboard revised</li>
<li>Partly optimized code</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>WP-Piwik dashboard widgetized</li>
<li>Stats-boxes sortable and closeable</li>
<li>German language file added</li>
<li>Browser stats and bounced visitors</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>First public version</li>
</ul>

Newsletters";s:4:"slug";s:18:"wysija-newsletters";s:7:"version";s:8:"2.7.11.1";s:6:"author";s:47:"<a href="http://www.mailpoet.com/">MailPoet</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:37:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/wysija";s:12:"contributors";a:1:{s:6:"wysija";s:37:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/wysija";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.5";s:6:"tested";s:3:"4.8";s:6:"rating";d:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2450;i:4;i:135;i:3;i:25;i:2;i:14;i:1;i:69;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2693;s:15:"support_threads";i:176;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:98;s:10:"downloaded";i:6329996;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-07-18 1:38pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-12-03";s:8:"homepage";s:24:"http://www.mailpoet.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3615:"<p>Create newsletters, automated emails, post notifications and autoresponders. Capture subscribers with our signup widget. Drop your posts, images, social icons in your newsletter. Change fonts and colors on the fly. A simple newsletter solution for WordPress. Finally!</p>
<p>We built it with the idea that newsletters in WordPress should be easy. Not hard. Forget MailChimp, Aweber, etc. We&#8217;re the good guys inside your WordPress.</p>
<p><a href="http://demo.mailpoet.com/launch/" rel="nofollow">Try the demo.</a></p>
<h4>Check out this 2 minute video.</h4>
<p><div class="embed-vimeo" style="text-align: center;"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/130151897" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe></div>
</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Drag-and-drop newsletter designer</li>
<li>Send your latest posts automatically</li>
<li>Autoresponders (e.g., &#8220;send email 3 days after someone subscribes&#8221;)</li>
<li>Send emails to your WordPress users</li>
<li>Start collecting subscribers in 2-clicks with our subscription widget</li>
<li>Your choice of single or double opt-in</li>
<li>Import subscribers in 2 easy steps</li>
<li>Get statistics for your newsletters: opens, clicks, unsubscribes</li>
<li>Drag-and-drop subscription form designer</li>
<li>Perfect rendering that makes your newsletters look the same on mobile devices (iPhone, Android) and desktop/web email clients (Gmail, Outlooki, Yahoo, Hotmai, etc.)</li>
<li>Send with your own web host or, third-party SMTP (e.g., SendGrid, Amazon SES, Gmail, etc.), or third-party API (SendGrid, Elastic EMail, etc.)</li>
<li>Segment your lists based on unopened, opened and clicked rates</li>
<li><a href="http://www.mailpoet.com/newsletter-templates-wordpress/" rel="nofollow">Selection of over 70 themes</a>. Photoshop files included!</li>
<li>Sending newsletters in the free version is limited to 2000 subscribers</li>
</ul>
<h4>Premium version</h4>
<p><a href="http://www.mailpoet.com/premium/" rel="nofollow">MailPoet Premium</a> offers these nifty extra features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Send to more than 2000 subscribers</li>
<li>A beautiful statistics dashboard to compare your newsletters and subscribers</li>
<li>Detailed stats for each subscriber and newsletter</li>
<li>Automated bounce handling that keeps your subscribers&#8217; list clean</li>
<li>Test your SPAM score before you send a newsletter to your subscribers</li>
<li>Improve deliverability with DKIM signature</li>
<li>Simple install process</li>
<li>Priority support: let us optimize your settings!</li>
</ul>
<p><a href="http://www.mailpoet.com/premium/" rel="nofollow">Visit our Premium page</a>.</p>
<h4>Support</h4>
<p>Find over 80 articles in our documentation:</p>
<p><a href="http://support.mailpoet.com/" rel="nofollow">support.mailpoet.com</a></p>
<h4>Translations in your language</h4>
<p><a href="http://support.mailpoet.com/knowledgebase/translations-in-your-language/" rel="nofollow">Get a Premium plugin license in exchange for your help in translation</a></p>
<ul>
<li>Arabic</li>
<li>Basque</li>
<li>Catalan</li>
<li>Chinese</li>
<li>Croatian</li>
<li>Czech</li>

<li>Dutch</li>
<li>French (but of course!)</li>
<li>German</li>
<li>Greek</li>
<li>Hebrew</li>

</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:970:"<p>There are 3 ways to install this plugin:</p>
<h4>1. The super easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Search for <code>mailpoet</code></li>
<li>Click to install</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>2. The easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page</li>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Select the tab &#8220;Upload&#8221;</li>
<li>Upload the .zip file you just downloaded</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>3. The old and reliable way (FTP)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>wysija-newsletters</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:1178:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>There are 3 ways to install this plugin:</p>
<h4>1. The super easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Search for <code>mailpoet</code></li>
<li>Click to install</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>2. The easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page</li>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Select the tab &#8220;Upload&#8221;</li>
<li>Upload the .zip file you just downloaded</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>3. The old and reliable way (FTP)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>wysija-newsletters</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Got questions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Our <a href="http://support.mailpoet.com/" rel="nofollow">support site</a> has plenty of articles and a ticketing system.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:57164:"<h4>2.7.11.1 &#8211; 2017-07-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved welcome and update pages</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.10 &#8211; 2017-04-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Introduced minor changes to the premium page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.9 &#8211; 2017-04-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by Craig Smith. Thanks!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.8 &#8211; 2017-03-03</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed sending issues when MailPoet&#8217;s sending service is selected</li>
<li>Fixed sending post notifications when tag filters are used</li>
<li>Fixed the display of incorrect newsletter title in browser preview</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices associated with sending on multisite hosts</li>
<li>Fixed broken DKIM signing</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.7 &#8211; 2017-01-31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed activation issues on PHP 5.2</li>
<li>Removed PHPMailer library in compliance with the new WordPress security policy. Please report any sending issues!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.6 &#8211; 2017-01-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed post categories not being displayed in sent newsletters</li>
<li>Fixed PHPMailer vulnerability</li>
<li>Fixed PEAR POP3&#8217;s usage of static methods</li>
<li>Fixed direct manipulation of the $wp_filter global</li>
<li>Fixed BBPress unsubscribe compatibility</li>
<li>Added ElasticEmail unsubscribe tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.5 &#8211; 2016-08-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed subscription form widget</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.4 &#8211; 2016-08-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed error appearing during newsletter creation</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.3 &#8211; 2016-08-08</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed issue with emoji when saving newsletters</li>
<li>Prevent encoding of &#8220;tel:&#8221; URLs</li>
<li>Fixed SQL injection vulnerability (Thanks to Force Interactive)</li>
<li>Fixed XSS vulnerability (Thanks to Sipke Mellema from Securify B.V.)</li>
<li>Fixed PHP warnings on Bounce management</li>
<li>Escape commma and quote marks during export</li>
<li>Fixed some editor issues</li>
<li>Fixed double signed DKIM emails</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.2 &#8211; 2016-06-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed broken CSS for Premium page</li>
<li>Fixed Custom Fields not saving on front-end</li>
<li>Fixed image ratio for specific locations</li>
<li>Fixed issue with missing rule (onlyNumberSp) in Italian &amp; German translations</li>
<li>Fixed broken email validation in Dutch language with long extensions</li>
<li>Fixed undefined property notice on Bounce pages</li>
<li>Added SparkPost API support</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks again to Falk Huber (T-Systems) for reporting them</li>
<li>Added new menu icon (New MailPoet Branding)</li>
<li>Fixed sending preview of an email with an empty subject</li>
<li>Added Ukrainian JS validation language</li>
<li>Replaced deprecated get_currentuserinfo() with wp_get_current_user()</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices that may have appeared during the sending process</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.1 &#8211; 2016-03-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Falk Huber for letting us now.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7 &#8211; 2016-01-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enabled PHP7 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Immunity and Netsparker (https://www.netsparker.com) for alerting us.</li>
<li>Fixed an issue with newsletters not saving during the creation process</li>
<li>Disabled SSL verification on hosts with invalid SSL certificates and PHP 5.6</li>
<li>Updated SendGrid mailer</li>
<li>Improved URL validation logic</li>
<li>Addressed PHP notices that appeared in cron output</li>
<li>Fixed other minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.19 &#8211; 2015-10-13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a URL validation issue when WP&#8217;s home &amp; site URLs are different. Kudos to Divaldo for pointing it out.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.18 &#8211; 2015-09-21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed URL validation issue</li>
<li>Improved newsletter/subscriber search</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.17 &#8211; 2015-09-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enhanced redirection check in email URLs.</li>
<li>Fixed old-style PHP constructors.</li>
<li>Fixed newsletter preview bug.</li>
<li>Fixed import issues on old PHP versions.</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.16 &#8211; 2015-06-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added HHVM support</li>
<li>Added MariaDB support</li>
<li>Fixed import issue where existing subscriber&#8217;s data was not updated</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.15 &#8211; 2015-02-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed hidden signup confirmation when the theme &#8220;Twenty Fifteen&#8221; is activated</li>
<li>Fixed import issue on Windows servers, all valid subscribers CSV files can be imported now</li>
<li>Fixed the filter &#8220;Subscribers in no list&#8221; in the Subscribers&#8217; listing in the backend</li>
<li>Fixed bug in the frontend subscriptions page with the shortcode [wysija_page] not being replaced</li>
<li>Fixed rendering issue when sending WordPress Post notifications including multiple levels of nested HTML lists(ul &amp; ol)</li>
<li>Improved performance in the Subscribers&#8217; listing</li>
<li>Improved scheduled tasks process responses for greater reliability</li>
<li>Added &#8220;WBounce&#8221; to our list of compatible plugins in Settings &gt; Add-ons</li>
<li>Added non-translated strings for the subscribe and unsubscribe admin notifications</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.14 &#8211; 2014-11-26</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed all of the RTL issues on delivered newsletters and their web version</li>
<li>Fixed issue when importing subscribers with new custom fields</li>
<li>Fixed duplicated Monthly post notifications issue</li>
<li>Fixed View in Browser version deactivation</li>
<li>Removed option to switch to Beta</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.13 &#8211; 2014-10-27</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a conflict with the plugin <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/magic-action-box/">Magic Action Box</a></li>
<li>Fixed blank export file when exporting subscribers with custom fields</li>
<li>Fixed the default subscribers ordering in the backend, we now display the most recent first</li>
<li>Fixed the bug on Bold and Italic commands in our newsletter editor</li>
<li>Fixed an issue on the new bulk resend confirmation email feature</li>
<li>Fixed bounce management issue (Premium only), counting until 3 when a mailbox is full</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.12 &#8211; 2014-10-16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved security thanks to Dominik Schilling, <a href="http://planetzuda.com" rel="nofollow">Ryan Satterfield</a> and <a href="https://logicaltrust.net/en/" rel="nofollow">Logical Trust</a></li>
<li>Improved performance issue</li>
<li>Improved email rendering</li>
<li>Improved our stats dashboard, now they have a few more goodiness attached to them</li>
<li>Improved Subscribers&#8217; Export, better data encoding for Windows servers</li>
<li>Improved Form Editor, Date fields now accept dates prior to 1970</li>
<li>Fixed conflict with EditFlow in our Visual Editor</li>
<li>Fixed rare bug on Windows Server stopping you from sending emails</li>
<li>Added option to Resend confirmation email in the Subscriber&#8217;s listing</li>
<li>Hard at work cleaning up our code and making it better</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.11 &#8211; 2014-08-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved protection against CSRF attacks thanks to Yoshinori Matsumoto.</li>
<li>Fixed bug on scheduled newsletters edited back and forth and becoming uneditable.</li>
<li>Fixed when duplicating an email through the stats page of a newsletter, then deleting the duplicate would also delete the original.</li>
<li>Old code Spring cleaning part 2, getting rid of the junk.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.10 &#8211; 2014-08-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved protection of themes upload, unsubscribe links, file access and statistics.</li>
<li>Improved the &#8220;Send a test email&#8221; function.</li>
<li>Fixed never ending process while sending previews on certain servers.</li>
<li>Fixed a few regular expressions for a better rendering in Outlook.</li>
<li>Fixed memory issue when dropping the &#8220;WordPress Post&#8221; widget on sites with thousands of taxonomies.</li>
<li>Fixed wrong subscribers count in the subscribers&#8217; listing.</li>
<li>Old code Spring cleaning, removed unused rusty pieces.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.9 &#8211; 2014-07-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed email display issues caused by responsive CSS. We&#8217;re truly sorry for this.</li>
<li>New columns on Subscribers page: &#8220;Never opened or clicked&#8221;</li>
<li>Removed &#8220;Unconfirmed&#8221; filter on Subscribers page when signup confirmation is off</li>
<li>Fixed a few minor bugs on the Statistics page for Premium users. Thanks for your feedbacks!</li>
<li>Fixed our hair with spray to look like cool kids in the eighties</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.8 &#8211; 2014-07-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by our dear Dominic. Thank you sir!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.7 &#8211; 2014-07-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added 1 more add-on to our plugin&#8217;s listing</li>
<li>Implemented a new Email Rendering Engine, with a lot of bugs fixed for Outlook users and Mobile Users</li>
<li>Fixed broken &#8220;Automatic Latest Content&#8221; settings on sites with lots of tags</li>
<li>Fixed fatal error when sending to more than 1 million total subscribers</li>
<li>Fixed subscribers page being inaccessible on some Multisites (very rare bug)</li>
<li>Fixed Outlook 2013 paragraph spacing issue on previous beta</li>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by <a href="http://sucuri.net/" rel="nofollow">Sucuri</a></li>
<li>Fixed the HTML button on TinyMCE which was hidden in editor</li>
<li>Fixed the links popup on TinyMCE for IE11 in editor</li>
<li>Fixed &#8220;automated latest content&#8221; (ALC) bugs with multiple Custom Post Types</li>
<li>Fixed the upload image functionality in our plugin</li>
<li>Fixed default item selected on filter lists at the Subscribers page for Firefox and Opera users</li>
<li>Fixed warning message appearing on the subscription form for Admin Users</li>
<li>Fixed a few typos in the plugin</li>
<li>Improved the CSV export to expand its compatibility with Excel on Windows</li>
<li>Improved the performance of the plugin when loading admin assets</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.6 &#8211; 2014-04-30</h4>

<li>Hey, we still have an issue with WordPress 3.9, our tinyMCE editor in Step 2 of the newsletter edition is not working properly (buttons are not usable)</li>
<li>No need to report us that issue, we&#8217;re already working hard to fix it. Thanks for your patience! 🙂</li>

<h4>2.6 &#8211; 2014-03-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>This is the juiciest of all releases. Ready?</li>
<li>a new statistics dashboard in Premium. The beauty of the big picture</li>
<li>add more fields in your subscription forms, like phone number, address, or whatever you like</li>
<li>display an archive of your past newsletters in a page with a shortcode. Find it in the settings</li>
<li>display your posts&#8217; author names and categories in the newsletter editor</li>
<li>insert several posts at once in the editor, instead of one at a time. Time saver</li>
<li>a dozen new display options when you drop your posts in the newsletter, for the control freaks</li>
<li>find a list of add-ons in the settings. Plug your MailPoet with your other favorite plugins, like Gravity Forms</li>
<li>select your own WordPress pages for your confirmation and unsubscribe pages</li>
<li>use your MailPoet shortcodes in your confirmation emails, like [user:firstname | default:reader]</li>
<li>MailPoet now abides to German privacy laws. Guten tag Alex!</li>
<li>the browser version of your newsletter now include the Google Analytics tracking code (Premium)</li>
<li>right to left language improvements</li>
<li>our user interface is now styled for 3.8</li>
<li>needless to say, hundreds of mini improvements</li>
<li>we hand over to you 6 months of hard work. Enjoy!</li>
</ul>

<li>fixed issue on IE8 where a draggable item was not disappearing after being dropped</li>
<li>fixed WordPress Synched list wrong count when sending</li>
<li>fixed image not being fetched from post content when inserting a WordPress post</li>
<li>fixed not sending auto newsletter with event &#8220;after a new user is added to your site&#8221; when double optin was off</li>
<li>fixed various plugins conflicting with our subscription form inserted into the content of a post or page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.7 &#8211; 2012-11-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>added MailPoet custom cron option in Advanced Settings as an alternative to wp-cron</li>
<li>fixed translation missing for &#8220;unsubscribe&#8221;, &#8220;view in your browser&#8221; and &#8220;manage your subscription&#8221; links</li>
<li>fixed escaping quotes on subject in step 3 send preview</li>
<li>fixed wrong total of subscribers when sending</li>
<li>fixed bounced tab appearing empty for free users</li>
<li>fixed wrong selection in WordPress posts widget after a search(in visual editor)</li>
<li>fixed security issue with swf uploading module</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.6 &#8211; 2012-11-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>added basic Custom Post Type support in WordPress post widget</li>
<li>added resend an Activation Email for another list even when already subscribed</li>
<li>added posts autoload on scroll when adding single post in newsletter visual editor</li>
<li>fixed PHP Notice: step2 of newsletter creation</li>
<li>fixed PHP Notice: on debug class</li>
<li>fixed our debug hijacking WP_DEBUG in the backend (thanks Ryann)</li>
<li>fixed deprecated in bounce handling</li>
<li>fixed scrollbar issue in WordPress Post popup on Chrome &amp; Safari</li>
<li>fixed conflict with Simple Links plugin</li>
<li>fixed toolbar tabs disappearing in some languages (will be improved)</li>
<li>fixed bounce error not properly displayed prevented saving settings</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.1.3 &#8211; 2012-09-18</h4>

<li>added restAPI for elasticemail when detected in the smtp configuration</li>
<li>improved install making sure that no crazy plugins will harm our initial setup (symptoms: Too many redirect crash or posting to social networks)</li>
<li>fixed SQL comments inserted as tables in some weird server&#8230;</li>
<li>fixed error 500 on update procedure of 2.1 when some roles were not existing. (add_cap on none object fatal error)</li>
<li>improved install process not creating new sql connection, only using wpdb&#8217;s one.</li>
<li>fixed synched plugins (Subscribe2 etc&#8230;) when there was just the main list</li>
<li>removed global css and javascript</li>
<li>fixed issue where the widget would not save</li>
<li>improved IE9 compatibility</li>
<li>fixed excerpt function to keep line breaks</li>

<li>fixed popups in IE8 and improved overall display</li>

<li>fixed error with dkim on server without openssl functions</li>
<li>fixed bounce error with the rule unsubscribe user</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.1 &#8211; 2012-09-02</h4>
<ul>

</ul>
<h4>2.1 &#8211; 2012-08-31</h4>
<ul>
<li>added ability for subscribers to change their email and lists.</li>
<li>added &#8220;View it in your browser&#8221; option.</li>
<li>added advanced access rights with capabilities for subscribers management, newsletter management, settings and subscription widget.</li>
<li>added new WordPress 3.3 plupload used when possible to use.</li>
<li>added mail-tester.com integration for Premium (fight against spam).</li>
<li>added DKIM signature for Premium to improve deliverability.</li>
<li>added the possibility to preview your newsletter without images in visual editor.</li>
<li>added background colors for blocks within the visual editor.</li>
<li>added alternate background colors for automatic latest post widget.</li>
<li>added possibility to add total number of subscribers in widget with shortcode.</li>
<li>added widget option &#8220;Display label within for Email field&#8221;.</li>
<li>improved email rendering and email clients compatibility including the new Outlook 2013</li>
<li>improved image upload with ssl.</li>
<li>improved compatibility with access rights plugins like &#8220;Advanced Access Manager&#8221; or &#8220;User Role Editor&#8221;.</li>
<li>improved import system with clearer message.</li>
<li>improved subscription widget, added security if there is no list selected.</li>
<li>improved Auto newsletter edition, warning added before pausing it.</li>
<li>improved popups for the visual editor (themes, images, add link,&#8230;)</li>
<li>updated TinyMCE to latest version, the editor now reflects the newsletter styles</li>
<li>compatibility with <a href="https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/magic-action-box/" rel="nofollow">Magic Action Box</a>.</li>
<li>fixed links style in headings.</li>
<li>fixed no default value in optin form when JS disabled.</li>
<li>fixed issue with automatic latest post widget where one article could appear more than once.</li>
</ul>

<li>fixed post notification interface (step1 and step3) not compatible with WordPress lower than 3.3</li>
<li>fixed issue when duplicating sent post notifications. You should not be able to copy a child email and then change it&#8217;s type like an automatic newsletter etc&#8230;</li>
<li>fixed zip format error when uploading your own theme (this error was happenning on various browsers)</li>
</ul>
